metadata.Title: CVE-2018-0737 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The OpenSSL RSA Key generation algorithm has been shown to be vulnerable to a cache timing side channel attack. An attacker with sufficient access to mount cache timing attacks during the RSA key generation process could recover the private key. Fixed in OpenSSL 1.1.0i-dev (Affected 1.1.0-1.1.0h). Fixed in OpenSSL 1.0.2p-dev (Affected 1.0.2b-1.0.2o).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-0737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.26
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.26
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Alejandro Cabrera Aldaya, Billy Brumley, Cesar Pereida Garcia and Luis Manuel Alvarez Tapia

notes.Note: mdeslaur> USN-3628-1 was releases with a possible incomplete fix. Next USN should add the three first commits listed below

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.26').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
